mickel.anim
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  mickel.anim.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
Controller, Qix, Swatch
public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an abstract model of an interactive object that can be animated on a Stage. Sprite objects can be programmed to move, change their appearance, and respond to user input (via keyboard and/or mouse).

In order to implement a specific type of Sprite object, the implementing class must "extend Sprite". For example:

public class Foo extends Sprite { ... }

The implementing class must also define the 2 following methods:

public void act() { ... }
public void draw(Graphics2D g) { ... }

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(mickel.io.Key k)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user pressing a key on the keyboard. A "key press" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc.

Parameters:
k - The pressed Key

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(mickel.io.Key k)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a key on the keyboard. A "key release" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc.

Parameters:
k - The released Key

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(mickel.io.Key k)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user types a key on the keyboard. A "key type" equates to a combination of "key press" and subsequent "key release", except that is applies only to UNICODE characters (i.e., SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. do not trigger this method).

Parameters:
k - The typed Key

mouseClicked

public void mouseClicked(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user clicking a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "click" equates to a "press" and subsequent "release" of a single mouse button.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse between the time that a "mouse press" and a "mouse release" occurs. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location after the movement has occurred.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseEntered

public void mouseEntered(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse into the area of the Stage window. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location where it entered the Stage.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseExited

public void mouseExited(int x,
                        int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse out of the area of the Stage window. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location where it exited the Stage.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseMoved

public void mouseMoved(int x,
                       int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse across an area of the Stage window. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location after the movement has occurred.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user pressing a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "press" equates to the first half of a "click" event.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(int x,
                          int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "release" equates to the second half of a "click" event.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position
